result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Jeffery Greer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:06 AM Defendant Matthew Jeffery Greer in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Matthew Jeffery Greer.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates resolution. Defendant will plead to 22CF113, recommend 3 years fashioned as 1.5 IC and 1.5 ES, imposed and stayed for 3 years, conditions of 45 days, 45 credit, DOC programming, completion of treatment court, $50 plus costs. in 22CM94 will be a deferred judgment, 22CM88 will be dismissed and all citation except 22TR980. Defendant pleads no contest to citation. Court orders find of 263.50 in 22TR980. 
Court recounts charges and possible penalties in 22CF113 and 22CM94. Defendant pleads no contest in both matters. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered on felony, judgment is deferred on misdemeanor. All remaining charges dismissed.
State indicates stipulation to reduction of bond. Cites priors. Asks court to adopt joint recommendations.
Defendant makes statements. 
Court orders 18 months IC, 18 months ES, I&S for 2 years probation, 45 days, 45 credit, DOC programming, $50 plus costs, 120 days to pay or payment plan, participate and successfully complete treatment court program.
Bond amended to $500 signature bond in 21CM94 with same conditions. 
Court orders
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

1:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew Jeffery Greer in court in custody. Att Ellen Craker makes special appearance
 Defendant received complaints. 
Court reads charges. Court reviews attorney options.
Defendant requests Public Defender
Att Craker Receives complaints, not guilty pleas in misd. charges, requests prelim in felony
Defendant gives Ruth House in Superior for mailing address
State requests 22CF113 $2000 cash, no drugs or paraph., 22CM88 $500 cash, No contact with victim 1 or residence. Lists lengthy criminal history in MN and prior FTA's, on probation in MN
Att Craker- has ties to area, family here, can't post.
Court- Has concerns on contact with area. Notes he is reversing bond request. On 22 CM88- $2000 cash bail,  No contact with Victim 1 or address. On 22CF113 $500 cash, no drugs or paraph. Sets dates
Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.
